skillTree.localised_description: The highest ranking Nobles often ride into battle on a mighty Bog Beast.

effects.description: Unlocks mount: Bog Beast

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.

effects.description: Armour: +10
Physical resistance: 5%

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: They have no worth. Their lives have no worth. They merely exist to die for the dark gods. Now drown your enemies in a tide of bodies.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -70% for Boglars, and Shearls units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -70% for Boglars, and Shearls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The elite of the Fimir warrior caste is superior in skill. Luckily for the civilized races, the Fimir usually can't afford to have many warriors of this might at the same time.

effects.description:
Recruitment rank: +4 for Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +15% for Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: +35% for Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Fimir may leave the will of the monsters they captured unbroken and release them ahead of the army to cause havoc. This tactic maintains their natural ferocity but makes them difficult to control.

effects.description:
Enables Guerilla Deployment for Bog Octopi and Fimm Mistmors
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Frenzy" for Bog Octopi and Fimm Mistmors
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Enables Rampage for Bog Octopi and Fimm Mistmors
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3
Weapon strength: +4%

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour: +15

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

effects.description: Leadership: +6
Leadership: +12

skillTree.localised_description: Blink and you die.

effects.description: Speed: +7%
Speed: +15%

skillTree.localised_name: Under the Eyes of the Gods
skillTree.localised_description: The Fimir will do anything for but a moment of attention from the Dark Gods. No act of bravery is too foolhardy, no act of cruelty too savage.

effects.description: Ability: "Under the Eyes of the Gods"

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Under the Eyes of the Gods

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Crude they may be, the skill and might of the Fimir Warriors makes them terrifying opponents.

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir aren't the fastest creatures, but they know about the value of mobility on the battlefield. Therefore they tame the faster, corrupted and dangerous creatures of their swampland homes to gain a tactical advantage.

skillTree.localised_description: The larger and stronger Fimir are used as shock troops, with devastating effect on the enemy.

skillTree.localised_description: It's hard to aim with only one eye, but the Fimir still use limited numbers of ranged troops.

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir are often accompanied by bigger, more terrifying swamp dwellers. Make no mistake though, the Fimir are the masters of these creatures and will use them with ruthless cunning.

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.

effects.description: Ability: "Fight or Die!"

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No act of faith amongst the Fimir can rival sacrifice of captured slaves; a dark and twisted offering in honour of Mud-Father Fimul and his children.

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

skillTree.localised_description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.

skillTree.localised_description: The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This Fimir practises Brollaidheacht, a form of wrestling popular with all castes where two Fimir will try to push one another outside of a sacred circle. The first to go out of the circle loses.
